result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle S Ewert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of the sentence. Court informed defendant he may petition court for expungement upon successful completion of probation and the he must submit a letter from his probation agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle S Ewert in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Kyle S Ewert in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties are prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Firearm warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for  4 days; Huber privileges for work, school, treatment, Day Reporting Center, and Electronic Monitoring.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 30 months with the following conditions:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Random urine screens.  No positive results.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No illegal drugs, no controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No contact with drug community.
- No contact with Kurtis S.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance to be paid during the term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge).  Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of costs, fees, assessments and surcharges is conversion into a civil judgment. 
- Court will allow defendant to be supervised by Dodge County.

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court informed defendant he may petition court for expungement upon successful completion of probation and that he must submit a letter from his probation agent.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Ineligible Votint Notice and Acknowledgement.

Attorney Chris Bailey in court, defendant Kyle S Ewert not in court, in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing. Defendant picked up a new case on Friday, June 6, 2014. Bail was set on the new case for $10,000.00. Case rescheduled for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle S Ewert not in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris Bailey in court.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant is to be monitored by drug testing.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Kyle S Ewert in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Kyle S Ewert in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
